Just to clarify - the "SamuraiWiki" is the new Japanese history
"Wiki", whi=
ch is to say it is the same software and is used the same
as Wikipedia.  Th=
is also means that you do not have to create an
account to do searches and =
read the information, etc.  Here is the
main page:

http://wiki.samurai-arc=
hives.com/

You only need to sign up if you want to edit or add articles.  =
That's
the only reason one would really need or want to sign up.  If you
ha=
ven't taken a look at the SamuraiWiki yet, it is worth poking
around. Some =
categories have hundreds of entries, others only 3 or 4.
It's only been onl=
ine for 2 months, so there is still a lot of work to
go. Some categories th=
at people here might find interesting could be
the "Samurai" Category:

htt=
p://wiki.samurai-archives.com/index.php?title=3DCategory:Samurai

The "Buju=
tsu" Category:

http://wiki.samurai-archives.com/index.php?title=3DCategory=
:Bujutsu

"Battles":

http://wiki.samurai-archives.com/index.php?title=3DCa=
tegory:Battles

And so on. There are about 1100 articles up so far.  If you=
 want to
contribute, there are only 2 rules:

1. Cite your sources.
2. If y=
ou plagarize from other sources, you will probably be banned
without a warn=
ing.
